questions.text: A primigravida who is admitted to the antenatal ward at 35 weeks is found to have a blood pressure of 160/110 mmHg. Her urine does not contain albumin. Which one of the following drugs should not be used in her management?

A woman is in labour. The cervical dilatation is 6 cm. The frequency of uterine contractions is 2 per 10 minutes. Amniotomy is done and an oxytocin infusion is commenced after 2 hours. Progress of labour is observed and recorded in the Partogram. What is the best parameter of progress of labour?

options.label: A
options.text: Descent of the fetal head assessed hourly.

options.label: B
options.text: Dilatation of the cervix assessed hourly.

options.label: C
options.text: Dilatation of the cervix assessed 4 hourly.

options.label: D
options.text: Frequency of uterine contractions assessed ½ hourly.

questions.correct_answer: C. Dilatation of the cervix assessed 4 hourly.

questions.text: A primipara with a dichorionic diamniotic twin pregnancy is in labour. The POA is 38 weeks. The first twin is in the cephalic presentation. The head is engaged and is in the occipito-anterior position. At 8 am, the cervical dilatation is 6 cm and at 12 noon, it is 7 cm. The membranes are intact. She is getting 2 uterine contractions per 10 minutes. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Allow labour to continue for 4 hours without interference.

options.label: D
options.text: Perform an amniotomy and commence an oxytocin infusion.

questions.correct_answer: D. Perform an amniotomy and commence an oxytocin infusion.

questions.text: A third para is found to have a cervical length of 21 mm on ultrasound scanning at 20 weeks. She has no history of previous preterm deliveries or cervical surgeries. What is the best method of prophylaxis against the occurrence of preterm labour?

options.label: A
options.text: Give nifedipine 10 mg daily till 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Insert a cervical cerclage and give vaginal progesterone

questions.correct_answer: B. Give vaginal progesterone 200 mg daily.

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct sequence of the cardinal movements of the fetus in the mechanism of normal labour?

options.label: A
options.text: Engagement, descent, flexion, internal rotation, extension, external rotation

options.label: B
options.text: Engagement, descent, internal rotation, flexion, restitution, extension

options.label: C
options.text: Descent, flexion, engagement, internal rotation, extension, external rotation

options.label: D
options.text: Engagement, descent, flexion, internal rotation, external rotation, extension

questions.correct_answer: A. Engagement, descent, flexion, internal rotation, extension, external rotation

questions.text: A woman is exposed to rubella infection at a period of amenorrhoea of 10 weeks. She has been vaccinated against rubella at the age of 15 years and had IgG antibodies against rubella on routine testing at 6 weeks. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer a booster dose of rubella vaccine to the mother.

options.label: C
options.text: Advice termination of pregnancy, if she contacts rubella.

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure that she is unlikely to develop

questions.correct_answer: D. Reassure that she is unlikely to develop

questions.text: A woman, who is on c-ART from 24 weeks, is admitted at a POA of 36 weeks, with a history of leaking amniotic fluid per vaginum for 2 hours. Viral load is 25 copies per ml. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: B
options.text: Commence steroids but augment labour immediately.

options.label: C
options.text: Commence intramuscular corticosteroids and await spontaneous onset of labour.

questions.correct_answer: B. Commence steroids but augment labour immediately.

questions.text: A rhesus-negative second para has an antibody titre of 4 IU/ml (IAT 1:4) at 8 weeks. Her husband is homozygous rhesus positive. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Assess middle cerebral artery blood flow from 18 weeks.

options.label: B
options.text: Assess the amniotic fluid bilirubin levels at 18 weeks.

options.label: C
options.text: Determine the fetal rhesus status by cordocentesis

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat the antibody titre in 4 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat the antibody titre in 4 weeks

questions.text: A woman with mitral stenosis is in the first stage of labour. The cervical dilatation is 4 cm and she is getting 2 uterine contractions per 10 minutes. She is in New York Heart Association Grade 2 state. Her ejection fraction is 60%. The fetal heart rate is 150 beats per minute. What is the most appropriate method of analgesia?

A 35-year-old second para, whose first pregnancy ended in a fetal death at 34 weeks, attends the preconception clinic. Which of the following is the best method to diagnose antiphospholipid syndrome as the cause of the fetal death?

options.label: A
options.text: History of at least one episode of thromboembolism.

options.label: B
options.text: One positive reading for lupus anti-coagulant.

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of anticardiolipin antibodies with raised INR and thrombocytopenia.

options.label: D
options.text: Two positive readings for lupus anticoagulant and / or anticardiolipin and /or anti B2 glycoprotein-1 antibodies at least 12 weeks apart.

questions.correct_answer: D. Two positive readings for lupus anticoagulant and / or anticardiolipin and /or anti B2 glycoprotein-1 antibodies at least 12 weeks apart.

questions.text: A primipara is in the 2nd stage of labour for three hours. She is getting 4 contractions per 10 minutes. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute and regular. On vaginal examination, the head is just above the level of the ischial spines with the sagittal suture in the transverse diameter of pelvis, with a caput and grade 3 moulding. The spines are prominent. The estimated fetal weight is 3.2kg. What is the best treatment option?

options.label: A
options.text: Wait for one hour for spontaneous rotation of the head and normal delivery.

options.label: B
options.text: Manually rotate the head and apply forceps.

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform a caesarean section immediately

questions.text: A woman is admitted at 37 weeks of gestation following a sudden episode of antepartum hemorrhage of approximately 300 cc. The bleeding has ceased on admission. She is not pale, blood pressure is 120/80 mmHg and the pulse rate is 76 beats per minute. The uterus is soft and non-tender. The fetus is in breech presentation. There are no palpable uterine contractions. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: C
options.text: Pelvic examination under anaesthesia with all preparations ready for caesarean section.

questions.text: The production of cervical mucus is stimulated by:

A lady underwent vaginal hysterectomy for Carcinoma cervix. Following the surgery after her urethral catheter was removed, she complained of urinary incontinence. On examination she has normal voiding as well as continuous incontinence. Methylene blue dye was instilled in her bladder through her urethra and she was given oral Phenazopyridine dye. After sometime, 3 cotton swabs which were kept in vagina were checked and it showed yellow staining at the top most pad, while the middle or bottom swabs were unstained. She is likely to have:
All of the following are SLING operations for uterine prolapse except:
All of the following are presentations of adenomyosis except:
A 28 years old female patient presented with abdominal pain along with dysmenorrhea. The following finding was seen on laparoscopic examination. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 40 years old woman presented to the gynaecologist with complaints of profuse vaginal discharge. There was no discharge from the cervix on the speculum examination. The diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis was made based upon all of the following findings on microscopy except:
In hysterosalpingography, fallopian tubes are seen beaded in appearance with clubbing of the fimbrial end and ampulla. Most likely cause is:

options.label: B
options.text: CT imaging of the abdomen & pelvis.

options.label: D
options.text: Surgical evaluation of the extent of intraabdominal diseases

questions.correct_answer: D. Surgical evaluation of the extent of intraabdominal diseases

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about the given contraceptive?

options.label: A
options.text: It has more chance of perforation than CuT 380A

options.label: B
options.text: It is a third generation IUD

options.label: C
options.text: The mechanism of action is chemical endometritis with prevention of implantation

options.label: D
options.text: It serves as a barrier contraception by blocking the cervical lumen.

questions.correct_answer: C. The mechanism of action is chemical endometritis with prevention of implantation

questions.text: A 65 years old patient has 3rd degree utero vaginal prolapse and rectocoele. She will require which surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair.

questions.correct_answer: A. Vaginal hysterectomy with pelvic floor repair.

questions.text: A 27 years old patient underwent caesarean section due to fetal distress. This was her first pregnancy and she had a spontaneous preterm labour at 35 weeks with cephalic presentation. Unfortunately, she had persistent variable decelerations in active labour and baby was delivered by caesarean section. According to ROBSON’s TEN GROUP classification, she will be grouped under which group?

A 50 year old male presented with chronic pain upper abdomen and bronze pigmentation of skin. He is a known case of diabetes for 5 years. On lab tests serum ferritin is high with low TIBC. Which of the following statement is true about his clinical disease?

options.label: D
options.text: Inherited as an autosomal recessive disorder

questions.correct_answer: D. Inherited as an autosomal recessive disorder

A patient 60-years-old man present with renal failure develops vomiting and restless in ICU. ABG Analysis showed Na + =145, Cl - =100, HCO 3 - =30, PaCO 2 =40 and pH= 7.40. What is the most likely metabolic abnormality?

options.label: A
options.text: High Anion gap metabolic acidosis with metabolic alkalosis

options.label: D
options.text: High Anion gap metabolic acidosis with normal anion gap metabolic acidosis

questions.correct_answer: A. High Anion gap metabolic acidosis with metabolic alkalosis

A 45-yrs-old obese man without known medical problems complains of feeling very sleepy during the day and often falling asleep while listening to friends. The most likely cause of this patient’s problem is:
questions.correct_answer: B. Upper airway obstruction at night

questions.text: A 60-yrs-old female complains of dry mouth and a gritty sensation in her eyes. She states it is sometimes difficult to speak for more than a few minutes. On exam, the buccal mucosa appears dry and the salivary glands are enlarged bilaterally. The next step in evaluation is:

options.label: B
options.text: Schirmer test and measurement of autoantibodies

questions.correct_answer: B. Schirmer test and measurement of autoantibodies

questions.text: The following statements about thyroglossal cyst are true, except:

options.label: A
options.text: frequent cause of anterior midline neck masses in the first decade of life.

options.label: B
options.text: The cyst is located within 2 cm of the midline.

questions.correct_answer: B. The cyst is located within 2 cm of the midline.

questions.text: True for Herring law of equal innervation are all except

options.label: A

questions.text: What procedure is done here?

A 32-year-old woman comes to the physician because of vaginal itching and a malodorous discharge that is worse following her menses. She is sexually active with two partners and recently had unprotected sex. Pelvic examination shows erythema of the cervix and malodorous frothy yellow-green discharge present in the cervical os and vaginal vault. Microscopic examination of vaginal secretions shown in the image. Name the motility of the pathogen?

A 29-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of swollen and painful knees and toes. He also has some low back stiffness that is worse in the morning, and he has been treated recently for conjunctivitis He also describes an onset of urgency, clear urethral discharge and dysuria, which started five weeks ago. He is sexually active and has monogamous relationship with the same person for the past 2 years. Which of the following is most likely to be found in this patient's history?

A 6-year-old child is brought to the emergency department by ambulance due to trouble breathing and a systemic rash. The child had been eating celery with peanut butter at lunch when her symptoms began. Vital signs reveal a temperature of 37.0°C, a blood pressure of 85/62 mm Hg, a heart rate of 124 beats per minute, and a respiratory rate of 35 breaths per minute. Physical exam reveals cyanosis, and lung auscultation reveals both inspiratory and expiratory wheezing with minimal air exchange and retraction. Which of the following cytokines would have blocked the development of Th cells that promote this type of reaction?

A medical student is participating in a summer research project and is given the task of developing a compound that targets only gram-positive bacteria. Which of the following components should she focus her research on?

A 6-year-old girl presents with diarrhea, vomiting and abdominal pain of 3-day duration. The girl and her mother deny seeing blood in her stool. The mother reports that the family returned from visiting relatives in Vietnam a few weeks ago. The girl’s vitals are unremarkable. Examination reveals diffuse abdominal tenderness. A CBC demonstrates eosinophilia and the stool ova and parasite examination confirms the pathogen as shown in the image. . Identification of which of the following will confirm this diagnosis?

A 28-year-old man comes to the physician because of a fever, mild headache and sore throat. His temperature is 102.2°F and his pulse is 90/min. Physical examination shows generalized lymphadenopathy and a diffuse bronze-colored maculopapular rash covering the body, palms and soles as shown in the image. Which of the following laboratory studies is the most appropriate next step?

A 54-year-old man who is a farmer in rural area comes to the physician because of a chronic cough. A chest x-ray shows a mass lesion with hilar lymphadenopathy. Examination of tissue obtained on biopsy of the mass shows multiple tiny oval forms within macrophages Which of the following is the most likely underlying condition?

A 34-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a painful, tingling lesion on her upper lip. A photograph of the lesion is shown here. She says that she is preparing for her wedding in a few days. Which of the following best describes the most likely causal agent?

options.label: A
options.text: A double-stranded circular DNA virus that is naked

options.label: B
options.text: A double-stranded DNA virus that has a complex lipid envelope

options.label: C
options.text: A double-stranded DNA virus that is enveloped and icosahedral

options.label: D
options.text: A negative-sense, single-stranded RNA virus that is enveloped

questions.correct_answer: C. A double-stranded DNA virus that is enveloped and icosahedral

questions.text: A 34-year-old man develops malaise fatigue and anorexia after returning from a trip to Calcutta. His symptoms slowly resolve and he does not seek treatment. Three months later, laboratory tests of his serum show: HBcAb- Positive, HBeAb - Positive, HBeAg- Negative, HBsAg- Negative, HBsAb -Negative. The absence of HBsAg and HBsAb is likely indicative of which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The patient has been successfully vaccinated against hepatitis B

options.label: B
options.text: The patient is in convalescent stage

options.label: C
options.text: The patient has past infection with HBV

options.label: D
options.text: The patient is in the window period

questions.correct_answer: D. The patient is in the window period

questions.text: A 50-year-old man comes to the physician because of a chronic cough. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 30 years. Crackles and wheezes are heard on auscultation of the chest. A chest x-ray shows no abnormalities. Gram stain of the sputum shows gram-negative pleomorphic coccobacilli. Choose the correct selective medium for this pathogen?
Meningitis can cause what condition that may preclude cochlear implantation?

A previously well child was referred from a secondary healthcare centre with a 4-day history of fever, lethargy and left lateral neck swelling. She developed stridor and poor oral intake 2 days prior to admission. However, there were no episodes of cyanosis, vomiting or regurgitation. There were also no cough, ear discharge, previous trauma or insect bite and negative history of contact with tuberculosis-infected person . On examination, the child was pink but lethargic, tachycardic and febrile at 39°C, with the presence of an audible stridor and drooling of saliva. Neck examination revealed an inflamed 4 cm x 3 cm swelling at the left lateral aspect of the neck. There was no cervical lymphadenopathy and other systemic examinations were unremarkable. Full blood counts showed Leucocytosis with a white cell count of 15.5×10 5 . On oral examination tonsil was pushed medially, Choose the most appropriate statement regarding diagnosis of the child

options.label: A
options.text: Has no anatomical floor, allowing communication from skull base to superior mediastinum.

options.label: B
options.text: There is free communication with the retropharyngeal space.

options.label: C
options.text: Contents include the carotid sheath, facial nerve, and deep cervical lymph nodes.

options.label: D
options.text: In drainage of a parapharyngeal abscess the approach is posterior to sternomastoid.

questions.correct_answer: A. Has no anatomical floor, allowing communication from skull base to superior mediastinum.

questions.text: In evaluating a patient with a temporal bone fracture, which presentation is most indicative of a facial nerve paralysis due to anatomical discontinuity of the nerve?

options.label: A
options.text: A patient with initial presentation of decreased facial movement

options.label: B
options.text: A patient with initial presentation of no voluntary facial movement

options.label: C
options.text: A patient with initial Glasgow Coma scale of 3

options.label: D
options.text: A patient who initially had facial movement, but progresses to no facial movement over the next several days

questions.correct_answer: B. A patient with initial presentation of no voluntary facial movement

During a revision stapedectomy, the previously placed piston prosthesis is noted to be displaced out of the stapedotomy and the lenticular and distal long process are absent, but a majority of the long process is still present. What is the best way to proceed?

options.label: A
options.text: Use a notched bucket-handle prosthesis between the incus long process and the stapedotomy

options.label: B
options.text: Use a total ossicular replacement prosthesis between the stapes footplate and the malleus

options.label: C
options.text: Use a partial ossicular replacement prosthesis between the stapes footplate and the incus

options.label: D
options.text: Use a shorter piston from the distal incus to the Stapedotomy

questions.correct_answer: A. Use a notched bucket-handle prosthesis between the incus long process and the stapedotomy

A patient is unable to prevent anterior displacement of the femur on the tibia when the knee is flexed. Which of the following ligaments is most likely damaged?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ The posterior cruciate ligament is important because it prevents forward displacement of the femur on the tibia when the knee is flexed. The anterior cruciate ligament prevents backward displacement of the femur on the tibia.
  • ↳ The posterior cruciate ligament is important because it prevents forward displacement of the femur on the tibia when the knee is flexed.
  • ↳ The anterior cruciate ligament prevents backward displacement of the femur on the tibia.

questions.text: Which artery forming Kiesselbach’s plexus is is not a branch of External carotid artery:
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ Kiesselbach’s plexus is formed by :
  • ↳ 1. Septal branch of the anterior ethmoidal artery (a branch of ophthalmic artery). 2. Septal branch of the sphenopalatine artery (a branch of maxillary artery). 3.Septal branch of the greater palatine artery (a branch of maxillary artery). 4.Septal branch of the superior labial artery (a branch of facial artery).

questions.text: Anterior and posterior intercostals arteries pass between which two layers?

options.label: D
options.text: Innermost intercostal muscles and transversalis fascia

questions.correct_answer: C. Internal and innermost intercostals muscles
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ Anterior and posterior intercostal arteries pass between the internal and innermost intercostals muscles.
  • ↳ Anterior and posterior intercostal arteries pass between the internal and innermost intercostals muscles.

questions.text: A 14 years old adolescent girl is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after she collapsed while walking with a friend. She is awake and able to follow commands but is not speaking. Her pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light; extraocular movements are intact, and she can close her eyes completely. Her smile is asymmetric. She is moving her left arm and leg vigorously; there is minimal movement in the right arm and leg. She is unable to ambulate. A head computed tomography scan is normal. The girl is admitted to the pediatric intensive care unit for observation with a diagnosis of seizure with a post-ictal paralysis Over the next 12 hours, the girl's hemiparesis remains unchanged. Her friend reports that the girl collapsed while walking; she did not lose consciousness, had no abnormal movements, and was unable to get up or speak. Of the following, the BEST next diagnostic study to order in the management of this child is

A 5-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with decreased urine output for 1 day. He has had diarrhea vomiting, and poor oral intake for 5 days, He has not received any medications. The boy's temperature is 38.6 °C, heart rate is 130 beats/min, respiratory rate is 20 breaths/min, and blood pressure is 80/50 mm of Hg. He is lethargic, his mucous membranes are dry, and the capillary refill is more than 3 seconds. His chest is clear to auscultation. Laboratory data are shown: Blood White blood cell count 15,200/μL (15.2 x 109/L) Hemoglobin 12.1 g/dL (121 g/L) Platelet count 300 x103 /μL (300 x 109/L) Blood urea nitrogen 56 mg/dL (20 mmol/L) Creatinine 2.5 mg/dL (221 μmol/L) Urine: Specific gravity 1.015 Leukocyte esterase 1+ Nitrite Negative Blood Trace Protein 1+ Red blood cells 2-5/HPF White blood cells 5-10/HPF Casts Granular, 1-2/low-power field Of the following, this boy's MOST likely diagnosis is
Which of the following about FeNa is true?

options.label: B
options.text: In preterms, normal FeNa is more than 2%

questions.correct_answer: B. In preterms, normal FeNa is more than 2%

questions.text: What should be the order of investigations for a 3 yrs old boy with first episode UTI? i) Ultrasound ii) MCU iii) DMSA nuclear scan

A 2 years old boy is seen for a health supervision visit. His mother reports episodes of otitis media over the past year, which required the placement of myringotomy tubes. He has had 10 to 12 episodes of upper respiratory tract infection over his lifetime. He has coarse facial features, macrocephaly, contractures of hands, a gibbus deformity, and corneal clouding. His liver is palpable 3 cm below the right costal margin. His height is 2.5 standard deviations below the mean. Of the following, the diagnosis that is most consistent with the boy’s clinical features is
For which of the following, enzyme therapy is not successful?
Which of the following would be not expected in an infant of cystic fibrosis?
An adolescent comes to you with bilateral absent vas deferens and epididymis. What would be the most probable diagnosis?

A 3-day-old term male neonate is being evaluated in the emergency department for hypotonia and decreased feeding. The neonate was discharged to home yesterday after an uneventful delivery and postnatal period. He is hypotonic and difficult to arouse. His vital signs include a blood pressure of 68/40 mmHg, temperature of 37.3 C, heart rate of 170 beats/min, and respiratory rate of 80 breaths/min. Laboratory data are shown: Glucose 38 mg/dL (2.1 mmol/L) Creatinine 0.2 mg/dL (17.7 μmol/L) Blood urea nitrogen 16 mg/dL (5.7 mmo/L) Ammonia 35 μg/dL (25 μmol/L) Carbon dioxide 12 mEq/L (12 mmol/L) Lactate 41.4 mg/dL (4.6 mmol/L) Urine ketones Negative Anion gap 20 mEq/L (20 mmol/L) white blood cell count 8,000/μL (8 x 109/L) C-reactive protein 0.2 mg/dL (2 mg/L) Of the following, the neonate's MOST likely diagnosis is
What is the best feed for a baby if mother is not available?
If a child presents with protein energy malnutrition and shows signs of subcutaneous fat loss and weight reduction. The level of prevention suggested at this point is:
questions.correct_answer: C. Early diagnosis and prompt treatment.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • As the child hasn’t developed any complications so early diagnosis and treatment will prevent the child from developing any form of complications.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man who works in textile company visited hospital for routine health check-up. He prepares benzidine in company from last 18 years. Which of the following investigation would you recommend for this patient?
questions.explanation:

questions.text: Study is done on a group of children to check seasonal variation of a sudden infant death syndrome in a summer season from June-July, and from August-September in another group with similar characteristics from same area. Which of the following test is used to compare the data?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Approach to Questions on Statistical Test
  • • Number of groups: 2 groups Unrelated as there are 2 separate groups. SIDS: Yes/ No (qualitative) Algorithm 1 Answer: Chi square
  • • Number of groups: 2 groups
  • • Number of groups: 2 groups
  • • Unrelated as there are 2 separate groups.
  • • Unrelated as there are 2 separate groups.
  • • SIDS: Yes/ No (qualitative)
  • • SIDS: Yes/ No (qualitative)
  • • Algorithm 1
  • • Algorithm 1
  • • Answer: Chi square
  • • Answer: Chi square

questions.text: Intraocular pressure was measured in 400 people. Mean was found to be 25mm of Hg. And standard deviation was recorded 10 mm of Hg. What would be confidence interval at 95% confidence level?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Whenever the word population or confidence is given, we have to calculate the SE and apply the same theorem.
  • • SE = SD/ Square root of n
  • • SE = 10/ Square root of 400 = 10/20 = 0.5
  • • Mean +- 2 SE = 95%
  • • 25+-2 * 0.5 = 24- 26

questions.text: The probability of rejecting the null hypothesis when it is true is called:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Approach to Questions on Hypothesis Testing:
  • • A. Read the question carefully and determine that in reality, and in RCT which hypothesis is correct.
  • • In this question in reality, Ho is correct and in RCT Ha is correct.
  • • In this question in reality, Ho is correct and in RCT Ha is correct.
  • • B. Draw perpendicular lines; point of intersection will give you the answer.

questions.text: Match the following:

options.text: To assess the quality of related services.

questions.correct_answer: A. To assess the quality of related services.
questions.explanation:

questions.text: A medical faculty is teaching students about principles of ethics in health care, the tells them that the utmost important principle to observe while taking care of patient is doing no harm. According to you the principle of ethics he/she described here is:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Key Principles of Ethics:
  • • Justice: equality to all Autonomy: freedom to choose Non – maleficence: do no harm. Beneficence: should have some benefit
  • • Justice: equality to all
  • • Autonomy: freedom to choose
  • • Non – maleficence: do no harm.
  • • Beneficence: should have some benefit

questions.text: Identify the image:
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • A sufficient cause as "...a complete causal mechanism" that "inevitably produces disease." Consequently, a "sufficient cause" is not a single factor, but a minimum set of factors and circumstances that, if present in a given individual, will produce the disease. Aschengrau and Seage use the example of causation of AIDS. A sufficient cause for AIDS might consist of the following components:
  • • Exposure to an individual with HIV Repeatedly engaging in risky sexual behavior with that individual Absence of antiretroviral drugs that reduce viral load of HIV
  • • Exposure to an individual with HIV
  • • Repeatedly engaging in risky sexual behavior with that individual
  • • Absence of antiretroviral drugs that reduce viral load of HIV
  • • The pie chart below might be used to represent the sufficient cause model for this scenario.

questions.text: The attributable risk calculated for smoking and lung cancer is 95%. Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence in total population – Incidence in non-exposed

options.label: C
options.text: If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the non-exposed

options.label: D
options.text: If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the population

questions.correct_answer: A. Incidence among exposed – Incidence among non-exposed
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • If smoking is eliminated as risk factor there will be 95% reduction in annual incidence of lung cancer cases among the exposed.

questions.text: As per Anaemia Mukt Bharat, what is the treatment for a primi 34 weeks with mild to moderate anaemia?

options.label: A
options.text: Injection ferric carboxy maltose if not tolerating oral iron

options.label: B
options.text: 2 tablets of oral iron/ folic acid + iron sucrose

options.label: D
options.text: Injection iron sucrose if not tolerating oral iron.

questions.correct_answer: D. Injection iron sucrose if not tolerating oral iron.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Anaemia Management Protocol under I- NIPI : Pregnancy
  • • Periodicity: At every ANC visit Mild to Moderate anaemia (Hb 7- 10.9) : Management: IFA (BD) or IVIS (for poor compliance patients or those in late months of gestation) Follow up: every 2 months If no improvement (Hb < 1g/ dL increase) after 1 month of treatment; refer to FRU/ DH Severe anaemia (Hb 5- 6.9) : done by Dr. at PHC/ FRU/ DH by IVIS
  • • Periodicity: At every ANC visit
  • • Mild to Moderate anaemia (Hb 7- 10.9) : Management: IFA (BD) or IVIS (for poor compliance patients or those in late months of gestation) Follow up: every 2 months If no improvement (Hb < 1g/ dL increase) after 1 month of treatment; refer to FRU/ DH
  • • Management: IFA (BD) or IVIS (for poor compliance patients or those in late months of gestation) Follow up: every 2 months If no improvement (Hb < 1g/ dL increase) after 1 month of treatment; refer to FRU/ DH
  • • Management: IFA (BD) or IVIS (for poor compliance patients or those in late months of gestation)
  • • Follow up: every 2 months
  • • If no improvement (Hb < 1g/ dL increase) after 1 month of treatment; refer to FRU/ DH
  • • Severe anaemia (Hb 5- 6.9) : done by Dr. at PHC/ FRU/ DH by IVIS
